H0.text: January 18, 1936 saw the death of what English writer and youngest recipient of the Nobel prize in Literature, responsible for such classics as The Jungle Book, The Man Who Would Be King, Gunga Din, and If. H.G. Wells

H1.text: January 18, 1936 saw the death of what English writer and youngest recipient of the Nobel prize in Literature, responsible for such classics as The Jungle Book, The Man Who Would Be King, Gunga Din, and If. E.M. Forster

H2.text: January 18, 1936 saw the death of what English writer and youngest recipient of the Nobel prize in Literature, responsible for such classics as The Jungle Book, The Man Who Would Be King, Gunga Din, and If. Virginia Woolf

H3.text: January 18, 1936 saw the death of what English writer and youngest recipient of the Nobel prize in Literature, responsible for such classics as The Jungle Book, The Man Who Would Be King, Gunga Din, and If. Kipling

A4.text: Joseph Rudyard Kipling (30 December 1865 â€“ 18 January 1936) was an English journalist, novelist, poet and short-story writer.

A5.text: Kipling was the first English-language writer to receive the prize, and at 41, its youngest recipient to date.
